title: Registerd Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Riverside Community Hospital (Riverside, CA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed at their event for a position, and they called back and conveyed interest asking me if I would come to a step down ICU with potential to train and eventually transition into ICU. Never received a call back. Called a recruiter and followed up multiple times. Management lacks in professional communication. Two months later no response. Received Random call back stating they wanted to see where they could put me, told me PCU and that they would call back in a week. Received an email asking if I wanted the position at PCU a day later. Responded to email saying I’d be excited to come to PCU. No response. Over 2 months since initial interview and I contacted Human Resources and was given the response that they had no records of anything, but encouraged to come to their event. Came to their event to have ICU manger state that the other manager that randomly called felt I was not a good fit for her unit and she failed to communicate that with me in the call or later the following week even after the recruiter asked me if I wanted the job. Confusing and very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: If I were to go to an amusement park, where would it be and why?

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Riverside Community Hospital (Riverside, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by the recruiter in mid-July, attended a "meet & greet" at the end of July. Upon arrival there was well over 100 new grads there. Each one of us was told to pick 2 departments to choose from ( out of Med-surg, Telemetry, ICU and Float) then after waiting for over an hour in a line, we were told to pick 1 department. It felt very impersonal, and was very disorganized. Myself, along with a few other classmates, never heard back regarding our status or decision.

Why ICU?
Why RCH?
Tell us about yourself

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Riverside Community Hospital (Riverside, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for DAY position, and I got a call after 3 weeks after to schedule an appointment ( after receiving an email saying that I am not selected).  When I got a call from HR, she said the opening was for DAY SHIFT not NIGHT SHIFT. 

***BEWARE before you go to the interview***

YOU CAN'T GET A DAY SHIFT JOB ( NO DAY SHIFT),  YOU HAVE TO DO NIGHT SHIFT FIRST in order to get a DAY shift job due to the UNION. 

I was very frustrated by that fact after driving a total of 2 hours on my off day. I wasted a lot of time today.

I wouldn't have came to the interview if I knew that. 

They should have posted as night shift only, not day shift. 

I was informed about that at the beginning so I just left because it was wasting time. 

This hospital is unprofessional, baiting people with wrong job posting. 

This is not definitely the best hospital to apply in the area.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Riverside Community Hospital (Riverside, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed with three people (Dean, Assoc Dean, Director) in the nursing department. All were very kind. Very informative. Questions were not difficult but intuitive. Spent about 1.5 hours at interview talking. Spent time getting to know about me, CBU, and the program. Second interview will be presenting a lesson plan to a group. This group will include the Provost, Dean, and other group of people within the university, all which all have terminal degrees with teaching experience. These ladies made me feel very comfortable. I was quite impressed at what CBU is moving to accomplish and with the three interviewers. All very professional and very kind.   

Glassdoor is requiring I submit the outcome of the interview. I still have one more interview before a decision is made.
Interview Questions: Why do you wish to work here instead of staying at current employer? What are your expectations of hours and time spent at this job?
